_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:54:15 using v2.1
title: How has the proportion of category A calls attended within 19 minutes changed?
analysis_commentary:
The Government requires that when onward patient transport is required in a life threatening situation an ambulance should arrive on scene within 19 minutes.

As with the eight minute target, there has been a steady decline over the past three years in the proportion of Category A calls with an ambulance on scene by 19 minutes. There has been a deterioration in performance across all regions since March of this year. London was consistently the best performing region until March of this year, since when there has been a substantial drop in performance.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
